intro: Actaea nanchuanensis, commonly known as the Nanchuan bugbane, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, unbranched stems and large, showy white or pale pink flowers. The plant features palmately divided leaves that are typically compound and have a distinctive, feathery appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
